chunks.en: Do you V friends shave every day? I have an idea, what do you think?

My beard grows very fast, and I have to shave every morning, which is annoying. Razors and time are both costs.
I'm considering whether to go for laser hair removal directly, so it's done once and for all. Has anyone studied this? I heard that many men in Korea do this.
Granted.
I don't like effeminate looks. Having a little beard is also handsome, maybe because I'm handsome myself.
I can shave every day, but it can't not grow.
It's 2025, why are there still people who think that something is a symbol of a certain type of person?
I have to brush my teeth every day, it's so annoying. I suddenly have an idea, what do you all think?
Let it grow for a while before shaving, so the boss feels like you're racking your brains for the company every day.

A conversation between a female friend of mine and her boyfriend: Female: I bought a laser hair removal device, it's very clean and doesn't hurt, do you want to try it? Male: Okay, okay, we have to shave every day, and it's not clean, I'll just try yours Female: Then you are so suitable, it will not grow after I remove it, it is very convenient Male: What, it will never grow again?? Then no, isn't it an eunuch if you don't grow a beard Female: It won't grow forever, it won't grow again in a few months Male: Oh that's okay So this is the mentality of men towards beards, I hope it doesn't grow, but I can't accept that it will never grow.
Are these men from the Qing Dynasty? What era is it, and they still think that a man without a beard is an eunuch?
Why not just cut it off?
I clicked on and seriously looked at your profile picture for a while.
Castration solves all problems /dog
@weixind They probably don't even care about you.
I'm in Chengdu, and my friend said that I look like a bear when I have a beard, so I'm so scared that I shave every day.
My beard grows in half a day. I'm used to shaving every day, and it's done in five minutes.
Three minutes every morning. Men should look like men. What if you want to grow a beard when you're older?
Currently removing hair.
Are you just going to be a workhorse for a little longer with the time you save? If you want to grow a sexy little mustache when you're older, there's no turning back.
I usually shave while taking a shower at night, which doesn't take much time.
Isn't laser expensive? How many razor blades could you buy?
I don't like being a 'man-woman'. I think having a beard is good, it's a symbol of manhood.
